bioghist.p: Villanova University has featured intercollegiate competition since 1866. NCAA orientation visit took place in June 1995. This orientation visit as other visits, for example, February 2002 was to initiate the process towards NCAA Compliance Certification. The certification process is an opportunity to review, reinforce and refine athletic offerings in all intercollegiate activities. The purpose of certification is to ensure that the NCAAâ€™s commitment to integrity in intercollegiate athletics is being upheld by member institutions. Villanova concurs with the NCAA that a well-conducted self-study yields significant benefits in self-awareness, affirmation and opportunities to improve. Villanova had the opportunity to conduct a NCAA Certification Self-Study the first beginning in late 1994 and the following in April 2003. In each of these self-studies, Villanova included representatives from the Board of Trustees, administration, faculty, staff, students and alumni/ae. These were the constituents who served on the Steering Committee and Subcommittees and were involved in the respective self-study. Various techniques in gathering data were used in the process such as: interviews focus groups, survey and community forums. NCAA guidelines, handbook and instrument were used in preparing all self-studies.

scopecontent.p: Records of the NCAA Certification Committee consist of the following series: Correspondence (1994-2004); Minutes of the Certification Committee (1994-2002); and Reports (1995-2003). Reports include such items as an NCAA self-study instrument and handbook, peer reviews, responses and a 1995 student athlete opinion survey. The collection also includes a copy of the University's Self-Study including appendices, attachments, handbooks, and University bulletins.
